intro: Andryala diffusa, commonly known as the common yarrow, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small clusters of flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–90 cm, with slender, branching stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, appearing in clusters at the ends of the stems. Andryala diffusa is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its medicinal properties.
